awd_titl_txt: Integrating Construction Engineering and Geospatial Technician Projects
awd_abstract_narration:
Based on national data and specific input from Dallas/Fort Worth construction-related industries, great demand exists for geospatial and construction engineering technicians who have skills in the use location-based data. To educate students in these areas, transformative changes must be made within curricular material.  In response, Brookhaven College in Texas will engage industry to identify needed curricular revisions and will create learning modules to educate geospatial and engineering technicians about the spatial data technologies that support civil and construction engineering. By incorporating real-world, service-learning experiences into the curriculum, the project will seek to prepare technicians to enter the well-paying industries of civil engineering, commercial construction, and geospatial technology. The institution will align the new curriculum with the emerging field of constructioneering (http://constructioneering.com/) to educate construction industry professionals who are prepared to manage and integrate survey, engineering, and construction data, and to streamline construction workflows and improve project delivery. The project will also strive to create an environment that allows students to master interdisciplinary knowledge and technical skills in both engineering and geospatial technology.  The curriculum changes also aim to promote 21st century career-ready abilities that use technologies to improve efficiency and lower costs. This project is designed to serve as a national model for cross-disciplinary approaches to technology education. 

The project will investigate recent advances in imaging, spatial intelligence techniques, and analysis technologies, and adopt and adapt those technologies into new instructional materials in two ways: by creating new content modules that serve the needs of engineering and commercial construction industries; and by integrating cross-disciplinary field experiences throughout the content modules. These field experiences may help close the identified skills gaps between current curricula and real-world rapidly advancing technology applications and allow student teams to learn and practice the knowledge, skills and abilities needed on the job.  It is expected that, as a result, technicians will understand connections between related geospatial, construction, and engineering disciplines and will be better prepared to meet the needs of construction engineering-related industries. The curriculum materials will be designed for use in community college engineering and geospatial technician education programs, as well as for professional development by the incumbent workforce. Graduates who participate in this program have the potential to become resources and role models, and may expand community partnership opportunities. In addition to serving more traditional students, the project will also recruit students from a population traditionally underrepresented in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) fields (e.g., African American, Hispanic, and low-income students) and will create curricular materials based on research on how these groups learn.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

inst.inst_name: Dallas County Community College Dist Brookhaven College

perf_inst.perf_inst_name: Dallas County Community College Dist Brookhaven College

por.por_cntn:
The assessment activities in this grant project were conducted in both years of 2021 and 2022. The external evaluator helped the grant PI design survey instruments in alignment with grant goal and objectives.

Based on the data analysis of student survey responses and learning outcomes, there is a strong and positive indication that students involved in this grant project gained knowledge and improved their skills in the area of their study.

Students from GIS project provided valuable anecdotal feedback covering different aspects to their interest and course benefits associated with learning GIS technology. 

The students’ comments highlight several important points, 1) job opportunity is the top concern from the students. The new GIS technology can equip them with marketable skills for very broad fields. The technology offers a flexible work environment catering to the modern working style. 2) Learning environment in Dallas College enhances the overall learning experiences of students, taking care of students in different aspect, from learning engagement to mentorship and support and even the counseling services – a true learning environment for an all-person growth with various programs through quality education. 3) Connect school education with the real-world needs via internship programs, students were able to join industries and learned first-hand skills required by reality. Students’ feedback and comments have reflect the true mission of this grant project.

It is clear that the goal of this grant project, which is “to provide interdisciplinary opportunities for student to be exposed to 3D technologies”, has been achieved through increasing students’ knowledge in the area of their study, improving their hands-on skills to apply classroom knowledge to solve the real-world problems. Student assessments demonstrated that they  learned the knowledge that prepared them for the job market.

The grant program design contributed positively to the achievement of the goal. Different course modules were developed through the collaboration of instructors in diverse disciplinary areas, which guaranteed the extensive distribution of the knowledge and benefited more students. The partnership with industries further ascertain the value of the grant project that is making an organic connection between education and the real world. Students not only learned the knowledge in the classroom, but also presented their project to the representatives from the industries and received the first-hand valuable feedback for their learning and future career advice. This grant project demonstrated the right path for the education in the 21st century – connecting education with the reality and preparing students for the market needs. Equipped with modern technology, students will become a change agent to improve the quality of people’s lives and make valuable contributions to mankind.


Last Modified: 10/29/2022
Modified by: Jeffery S Sires
